entry.title: The Motor Vehicles (Insurance Requirements) (Immobilisation, Removal and Disposal) (Amendment) Regulations 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations (“the 2015 Regulations”) amend the Motor Vehicles (Insurance Requirements) (Immobilisation, Removal and Disposal) Regulations 2011 (“the 2011 Regulations”). The amendments in regulation 2(a) to (d) of the 2015 Regulations have been made in response to the Joint Committee on Statutory Instruments (“JCSI”) 25th report of Session 2010-12 which reported the 2011 Regulations for doubtful vires in four connected respects. Regulation 2(e) of the 2015 Regulations corrects a drafting error that was identified by the Department in relation to the test applied in paragraphs (4) and (8) of regulation 14 of the 2011 Regulations.

entry.title: The Electronic Commerce Directive (Financial Services and Markets) (Amendment) Order 2015

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Electronic Commerce Directive (Financial Services and Markets) (Amendment) Order 2015

entry.summary: This Order amends the Electronic Commerce Directive (Financial Services and Markets) Regulations 2002 (S.I. 2002/1775). Article 2 of this Order makes provision about persons who carry out certain consumer credit related activities and direct all or most of their activity to the United Kingdom market, but do so from another country in the European Economic Area in order to avoid certain regulatory requirements. Where the Financial Conduct Authority is satisfied that this is the case it may impose new regulatory requirements upon that person (new regulations 11A and 11B). The Authority may also determine that the person requires authorisation under the Financial Services and Markets Act 2000 in order to carry on the activity (new regulation 11C).

entry.title: The Freedom of Information (Designation as Public Authorities) Order 2015

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Freedom of Information (Designation as Public Authorities) Order 2015

entry.summary: The obligations under the Freedom of Information Act 2000 (“the Act”) apply to public authorities. For the purposes of the Act, a “public authority” includes a body or office which is designated by an order under section 5 of the Act. Section 5(1)(a) of the Act provides that the Secretary of State may, subject to certain limitations, by order designate as a public authority for the purposes of the Act a person who appears to the Secretary of State to exercise functions of a public nature.

entry.title: The National Health Service Pension Scheme (Consequential Provisions) (Scotland) Regulations 2015

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The National Health Service Pension Scheme (Consequential Provisions) (Scotland) Regulations 2015

entry.summary: These Regulations make consequential provision in relation to public service pensions for health service workers in Scotland.

entry.title: The Restraint Orders (Legal Aid Exception and Relevant Legal Aid Payments) Regulations 2015

ukm:Subject.Value: PROCEEDS OF CRIME, ENGLAND AND WALES

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Restraint Orders (Legal Aid Exception and Relevant Legal Aid Payments) Regulations 2015

category.term: PROCEEDS OF CRIME, ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: Sections 46 and 47 of the Crime and Courts Act 2013 (c. 22) (“the 2013 Act”) make provision to enable property that is subject to a restraint order in accordance with Part 2 of the Proceeds of Crime Act 2002 (c. 29) (“the 2002 Act”) to be used to make a relevant legal aid payment. A relevant legal aid payment is a payment that a person is obliged to make under legal aid legislation in relation to legal services provided to that person in connection with an offence which falls within section 41(5) of the 2002 Act.

entry.title: The Special Immigration Appeals Commission (Procedure) (Amendment) Rules 2015

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Special Immigration Appeals Commission (Procedure) (Amendment) Rules 2015

entry.summary: These Rules amend the Special Immigration Appeals Commission (Procedure) Rules 2003 (S.I. 2003/1034) (“the 2003 Rules”) as a consequence of amendments to the Special Immigration Appeals Commission Act 1997 (c. 68) (“the 1997 Act”) made by the Immigration Act 2014 (c. 22) (“the 2014 Act”).

entry.title: The Human Transplantation (Wales) Act 2013 (Consequential Provision) Order 2015

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Human Transplantation (Wales) Act 2013 (Consequential Provision) Order 2015

entry.summary: This Order makes provision for England and Northern Ireland in consequence of the Human Transplantation (Wales) Act 2013 (the “2013 Act”).

entry.title: The Electricity and Gas (Market Integrity and Transparency) (Enforcement etc.) (Amendment) Regulations 2015
entry.summary: Regulation (EU) No 1227/2011 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 25 October 2011 on wholesale energy market integrity and transparency (OJ No L 326, 08.12.2011, p1) (“REMIT”) imposes obligations and prohibitions in relation to trading in wholesale energy products within the European Union. “Wholesale energy products” are contracts and derivatives relating to electricity and gas, as defined in Article 2(4) of REMIT.

entry.title: The Firearms Regulations 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Firearms (Amendment) Act 1997 (“the Act”) and the Firearms (Northern Ireland) Order 2004 (“the 2004 Order”) in order to complete the implementation in the United Kingdom of Directive 2008/51/EC of the European Parliament and the Council of 21st May 2008 on control of the acquisition and possession of weapons (OJ No. L 179, 8.7.08, p5) which amends Directive 91/477/EEC of 18th June 1991.

entry.title: The Health and Social Care (Miscellaneous Revocations) Regulations 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations revoke the Regulations listed in regulation 2(1) of these Regulations. Regulation 2(2) also revokes, in so far as they apply in relation to England, the Regulations listed in that provision.

entry.title: The Legal Aid, Community Legal Service and Criminal Defence Service (Amendment) Regulations 2015

ukm:Subject.Value: LEGAL AID AND ADVICE, ENGLAND AND WALES

category.term: LEGAL AID AND ADVICE, ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: The Access to Justice Act 1999 (c. 22) (“AJA”) and the Legal Aid, Sentencing and Punishment of Offenders Act 2012 (c. 10) (“LASPO”) make provision for the determination of financial eligibility for legal aid and liability for contributions towards the cost of legal services. Regulations under the AJA and LASPO make provision for assessing an individual's financial resources for those purposes, including seeking information about the individual's receipt of prescribed benefits for the purposes of such determinations.

entry.title: The Pollution Prevention and Control Act 1999 (Commencement No. 4 and Amendment) (Scotland) Order 2015
entry.summary: This Order corrects an error in the Pollution Prevention and Control Act 1999 (Commencement No. 3) (Scotland) Order 2015 before that Order comes into force. Article 3 ensures that certain repeals to the Environment Act 1995 made by Schedule 3 to the Pollution Prevention and Control Act 1999 are clearly commenced on 1st April 2015.

entry.title: The Immigration Act 2014 (Commencement No. 5) Order 2015
entry.summary: This Order is the fifth commencement order made under the Immigration Act 2014.

entry.title: The Merchant Shipping (Standards of Training, Certification and Watchkeeping) Regulations 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations give effect to requirements of the International Convention on Standards of Training, Certification and Watchkeeping for Seafarers, 1978, as amended, most recently at Manila on 25th June 2010 (“the STCW Convention”). The Regulations implement in part Directive 2012/35/EU (O.J. L343, 14.12.2012, p78), which amended Directive 2008/10/EC on the minimum level of training of seafarers (O.J. L323, 3.12.2008, p33).

entry.title: The Family Procedure (Amendment) Rules 2015

ukm:Subject.Value: SENIOR COURTS OF ENGLAND AND WALES

category.term: SENIOR COURTS OF ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: These Rules amend the Family Procedure Rules 2010 (S.I. 2010/2955) (“the FPR”).

entry.title: The International Interests in Aircraft Equipment (Cape Town Convention) Regulations 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations give effect in UK law to the Cape Town Convention on International Interests in Mobile Equipment, together with its Protocol on Matters Specific to Aircraft Equipment.

entry.title: The Financial Services and Markets Act 2000 (Miscellaneous Provisions) Order 2015

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Financial Services and Markets Act 2000 (Miscellaneous Provisions) Order 2015

entry.summary: This Order amends provisions of the Financial Services and Markets Act 2000 (c. 8) (“the Act”), the Financial Services and Markets Act 2000 (Regulated Activities) Order 2001 (S.I. 2001/544) (“the Regulated Activities Order”) and the Financial Services and Markets Act 2000 (Financial Promotion) Order 2005 (S.I. 2005/1529) (“the Financial Promotion Order”) relating to consumer credit.

entry.title: The Local Authorities (Public Health Functions and Entry to Premises by Local Healthwatch Representatives) and Local Authority (Public Health, Health and Wellbeing Boards and Health Scrutiny) (Amendment) Regulations 2015

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Local Authorities (Public Health Functions and Entry to Premises by Local Healthwatch Representatives) and Local Authority (Public Health, Health and Wellbeing Boards and Health Scrutiny) (Amendment) Regulations 2015

entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Local Authorities (Public Health Functions and Entry to Premises by Local Healthwatch Representatives) Regulations 2013 (S.I. 2013/351) (“the principal Regulations”) and the Local Authority (Public Health, Health and Wellbeing Boards and Health Scrutiny) Regulations 2013 (S.I. 2013/218) (“the 2013 Regulations”).

entry.title: The Renewables Obligation Closure (Amendment) Order 2015
entry.summary: This Order amends the Renewables Obligation Closure Order 2014 (“the Closure Order”).

entry.title: The Health and Social Care (Miscellaneous Revocations etc.) Order 2015

ukm:Subject.Value: NATIONAL HEALTH SERVICE, ENGLAND AND WALES

category.term: NATIONAL HEALTH SERVICE, ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: This Order revokes the Orders and provisions listed in article 2(1) of this Order. It also revokes, in so far as they apply in relation to England, the Orders listed in article 2(2) of this Order. Article 2(3) revokes the Isles of Scilly (National Health Service) Order 1981, except in so far as it applies the Health Service Commissioners Act 1993 to those Isles.
